item.title: A log(n) Algorithm for Fibonacci Numbers
item.description: Explanation This algorithm is an exercise in the book Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs (1.19). Original method The usual way of computing the fibonacci number is by using the definition of fibonacci numbers: \[ f(0) = 0, f(1) = 1, f(n) = f(n-1) + f(n-2) \] It's trivial to write a recursive procedure to calculate fibonacci numbers, but the cost grows exponentially. Using memorization techniques and dynamic programming, we can achieve a linear time complexity.
